intro: Adenopus multiflorus, commonly known as the many-flowered adenopus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub with upright stems and produces numerous small, yellow flowers arranged in dense clusters. Its leaves are usually narrow and slightly hairy, and it thrives in well-drained soils. Adenopus multiflorus is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive appearance and adaptability to various environmental conditions.
